key_points: Clergy at St. Joseph Catholic Church comforted students and the community after a tragic shooting at Oxford High School.
Three students were killed and eight others wounded in the shooting, with three in critical condition.
The suspect, a 15-year-old Oxford High sophomore, fired 15 to 20 rounds from a semiautomatic handgun before surrendering.
The community gathered at St. Joseph, the closest Catholic parish to Oxford, for a Mass dedicated to healing.
Father Jim Kean and Father John Carlin offered spiritual and emotional support to the attendees.
Detroit Archbishop Allen H. Vigneron expressed his heartbreak and offered prayers for the victims and their families.
The Mass was a time for community members to come together, share their grief, and offer each other support.
Even non-Catholics attended the Mass, reflecting the community's solidarity.
The shooting is considered the worst school shooting in Michigan's history.
Community members, including an alumnus with personal connections to the victims, expressed their hopes and prayers for healing.
spokespersons: Father Jim Kean (Pastor of St. Joseph)
Father John Carlin (Associate Pastor at St. Joseph)
Gage Harris (Alumnus of St. Joseph School)
